What are the unique capabilities of the Verus testnet, and how do they enable users to have more control over their identities and funds?

The Verus testnet, available as the VRSCTEST coin, offers several capabilities that are unique in the crypto space today. Two of these capabilities are particularly noteworthy: self-sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (VerusID) and staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault).

**VerusID:**
VerusID enables users to register friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable. This means that users have complete control over their identities and funds, and can manage them in a permissionless manner. VerusID is already available on the mainnet.

**Verus Vault:**
Verus Vault enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. However, this lock does not prevent seamless staking of funds. When a user locks their identity, they specify an unlock delay, which is typically long enough to notice if someone has compromised their keys and is trying to unlock the ID. The only way to circumvent this unlock delay is to revoke and recover the ID. Additionally, users can choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking their ID, which enables a virtually theft-proof workflow. This feature solves several problems, including inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5-dollar wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs can be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network.

These capabilities are unique in the crypto space today and offer users a high degree of control and security over their identities and funds.
